description: Indulge in the delightful combination of creamy white chocolate and refreshing peppermint with these festive cookies. Perfect for holiday gatherings or as a sweet treat to enjoy at home, these cookies are sure to bring joy to your celebrations.
instructions: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, cream together the softened butter and granulated sugar until light and fluffy.
Add the peppermint extract and mix until combined.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
Fold in the white chocolate chips and crushed peppermint candies.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto the prepared baking sheet, spacing them about 2 inches apart.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the edges are lightly golden.
Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
tips: For the best results, ensure your butter is at room temperature and do not overmix the dough.

structured_content.content: I remember baking these cookies with my grandmother during the holidays, filling the kitchen with the sweet aroma of peppermint and chocolate. It was a tradition that brought us closer together and created cherished memories.

• Main ingredient: All-purpose flour is essential for the structure of the cookies; make sure to measure it correctly.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Peppermint extract adds a refreshing flavor; choose a pure extract for the best taste.
  • Supporting ingredients: White chocolate chips provide sweetness and creaminess, while crushed peppermint candies add a festive crunch.
  • Equipment needed: Baking sheets, parchment paper, mixing bowls, and a whisk are essential for this recipe.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Do not overmix the dough to keep cookies tender.
  • A common mistake is baking too long; watch for golden edges.
  • Cookies are ready when the edges are set and the centers look slightly soft.
  • Store in an airtight container to maintain freshness for up to a week.

structured_content.content: Sharing these cookies with friends and family during the holidays always brings joy and laughter. They are a symbol of togetherness and celebration.
For an extra flavor kick, try adding a pinch of sea salt on top before baking or substitute half of the white chocolate with dark chocolate for a richer taste.
These cookies pair wonderfully with a warm cup of cocoa or a glass of milk. Serve them on a festive platter for holiday gatherings.
For a gluten-free version, substitute the all-purpose flour with a gluten-free blend. You can also experiment with different types of chocolate or add nuts for added texture.
